question:
A 34-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-week history of colicky abdominal pain and diarrhea. He has bowel movements 10–12 times daily; the stool contains blood and mucus. Colonoscopy shows a bleeding, ulcerated rectal mucosa with several pseudopolyps. Which of the following is this patient at greatest risk of developing?
A. Hemolytic uremic syndrome
B. Oral ulcers
C. Colorectal cancer
D. Pancreatic cancer

A 64-year-old man with asthma on high-dose fluticasone inhaler presents with sore mouth for 1 week. Exam shows white patches on oral mucosa. What is the most appropriate next step in management?
A. Fluconazole
B. Isotretinoin
C. Nystatin
D. Penicillin V

A 45-year-old mechanic presents with acute-onset shortness of breath while repairing a tractor. He is pale, diaphoretic with contracted pupils. Diffuse wheezes are noted. What is the best treatment?
A. Succinylcholine
B. Inhaled ipratropium and oxygen
C. Atropine and pralidoxime
D. Inhaled albuterol and oxygen

What is the result of 15 × 7 + 23?
A. 105
B. 128
C. 135
D. 142

Which data structure uses LIFO (Last In First Out) principle?
A. Queue
B. Stack
C. Array
D. Linked List
